cleaned_text: at Healing Hands Chiropractic in Andover Township ANDOVER TOWNSHIP -- Dr. Bernadette Vallorosi, with the help of Andover Township Mayor Janis McGovern, held a ribbon-cutting ceremony for the grand opening of Healing Hands Chiropractic Center on Saturday, Nov. 24. There was a turnout of about 50 people for the open house at the 227 Newton-Sparta Road facility. Vallorosi is a Green Township resident and a chiropractic physician who specializes in sports injuries but also works with all types of patients, including children and elderly and everyone in between. Chiropractic care helps not only musculoskeletal conditions but also headaches, sciatica, disc injury, nerve pain and overall well-being. At Healing Hands there is a focus on the extremity and its function in relation to sports, therefore ankles, knees and shoulders are all addressed depending on sport activity. Vallorosi says chiropractic care also helps the brain function better and the immune system.
